summary: Thieves can claim a business’s tax refund by fraudulently using the business’s tax ID number and other identifying information. Between January 2017 and August 2019, IRS’s efforts to prevent this type of fraud helped keep $384 million out of criminals’ hands. However, we found that IRS could do more to combat this evolving threat. We made 6 recommendations to help IRS stay ahead of criminals...
title: Identity Theft: IRS Needs to Better Assess the Risks of Refund Fraud on Business-Related Returns
